1.text: Wilt thou draw out the crocodile with a hook and with a cord wilt thou press down his tongue?

2.text: Wilt thou put a rope in his nose? and wilt thou hollow out his jaw with a thorn?

3.text: Will he multiply supplications to thee? will he speak soft things to thee?

4.text: Will he cut out a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant forever?

5.text: Wilt thou play with him as a bird? and wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?

6.text: Shall companions give a feast upon him? shall they divide him between the Canaanites?

7.text: Wilt thou fill his skin with pointed weapons? and his head with fish spears?

8.text: Put thy hand upon him; remember the battle, thou shalt not add.

9.text: Behold, his hope was false: shall he not be cast down at his sight?

10.text: None fierce that he will rouse him up: and who is he will stand before me?

11.text: Who anticipated me, and I will recompense? under all the heavens it is to me.

12.text: I will not be silent for him, and the word of powers and the beauty of his preparation.

13.text: Who uncovered the face of his clothing? who shall come with his double bridle?

14.text: Who opened the doors of his face? his teeth a terror round about.

15.text: Pride of strong shields shut up with a seal of straitness.

16.text: One shall touch upon another, and the wind shall not come between them.

17.text: They will adhere each in his brotherhood, they will hold together, and they will not be separated.

18.text: His sneezings a light will shine, and his eyes as the eyelashes of the dawning of day.

19.text: From his mouth flaming torches shall go forth; sparks of fire will escape.

20.text: From his nostrils smoke will come forth as a blown pot, and a caldron.

21.text: His soul will kindle coals, and a flame will go forth from his mouth.

22.text: In his neck will lodge strength, and terror will leap before him.

23.text: The flaps of his flesh adhered: it will press upon him; it will not be moved.

24.text: His heart will press as a stone; and it will press as the under millstone.

25.text: His lifting up, the mighty will be stirred up: from breaking they shall purify themselves.

26.text: The sword reaching him, shall not be raised up: the spear, the dart, and the coat of mail.

27.text: He will reckon iron for straw, and brass for wood of rottenness.

28.text: The son of the bow shall not cause him to flee: sling-stones were turned to him for stubble.

29.text: The bludgeon was reckoned to him for stubble: and he will laugh at the shaking of the javelin.

30.text: Sharpnesses of the potsherd under him: he will spread a trench upon the mire.

31.text: He will cause the deep to boil as a pot: he will set the sea as ointment.

32.text: He will cause a beaten path to shine after him: the deep will be reckoned to be hoary.

33.text: None upon the dust being like him; he made him without fear.

34.text: He will see every thing high: he is king over all the sons of pride.
